snippet: "The Descendants" is trying to exploit its underdog status in a series of measures its studio, Fox Searchlight, hopes will gain it traction with Academy voters.
abstract: "The Descendants" is trying to exploit its underdog status in a series of measures its studio, Fox Searchlight, hopes will gain it traction with Academy voters.
lead_paragraph: Backlash or no, just about everyone can agree "The Artist" is the front-runner for best picture. But the folks behind "The Descendants" -- that would be Fox Searchlight -- aren't throwing in the towel. In fact, the family drama is trying to exploit its underdog status."The question this year has become whether 'The Descendants,' starring George Clooney and directed by Alexander Payne, can turn that same status into an asset," writes the Bagger's colleague, Brooks Barnes. "Or has it simply slipped too far back?" He explains how the studio has gone on the offensive, running commercials and dispatching Mr. Clooney and Mr. Payne to events that may look like post-nomination screenings but manage to skirt the Academy's rules on campaigning.
